001package io.jstach.rainbowgum;
002
003import static java.util.Objects.requireNonNullElse;
004
005import java.lang.System.Logger;
006import java.lang.System.Logger.Level;
007import java.text.MessageFormat;
008import java.util.ArrayList;
009import java.util.Collections;
010import java.util.IdentityHashMap;
011import java.util.List;
012import java.util.Objects;
013import java.util.ResourceBundle;
014import java.util.Set;
015import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentLinkedQueue;
016import java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock;
017import java.util.function.Consumer;
018import java.util.function.Function;
019
020import org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.NonNull;
021import org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Nullable;
022
023import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.Property;
024import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogPublisher.PublisherFactory;
025import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogRouter.RootRouter;
026import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogRouter.Route;
027import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogRouter.Router;
028import io.jstach.rainbowgum.annotation.CaseChanging;
029
030/**
031 * Routes messages to a publisher by providing a {@link Route} from a logger name and
032 * level.
033 */
034public sealed interface LogRouter extends LogLifecycle {
035
036        /**
037         * Finds a route.
038         * @param loggerName topic.
039         * @param level level.
040         * @return route never <code>null</code>.
041         */
042        public Route route(String loggerName, java.lang.System.Logger.Level level);
043
044        /**
045         * Creates (or reuses in the case of logging off) an event builder.
046         * @param loggerName logger name of the event.
047         * @param level level that the event should be set to.
048         * @return builder.
049         * @apiNote using the builder is slightly slower and possibly more garbage (if the
050         * builder is not marked for escape analysis) than just manually checking
051         * {@link Route#isEnabled()} and constructing the event using the LogEvent static
052         * "<code>of</code>" factory methods.
053         */
054        default LogEvent.Builder eventBuilder(String loggerName, Level level) {
055                var route = route(loggerName, level);
056                if (route.isEnabled()) {
057                        return new LogEventBuilder(route, level, loggerName);
058                }
059                return NoOpLogEventBuilder.NOOP;
060        }
061
062        /**
063         * Global router which is always available.
064         * @return global root router.
065         */
066        public static RootRouter global() {
067                return GlobalLogRouter.INSTANCE;
068        }
069
070        /**
071         * A route is similar to a SLF4J Logger or System Logger but has a much simpler
072         * contract.
073         *
074         * The proper usage of Route in most cases is to call {@link #isEnabled()} before
075         * calling {@link #log(LogEvent)}.
076         *
077         * That is {@link #log(LogEvent)} does not do any checking if the event is allowed
078         * furthermore by first checking if {@link #isEnabled()} is true one can decide
079         * whether or not to create a {@link LogEvent}.
080         */
081        public interface Route extends LogEventLogger {
082
083                /**
084                 * Determines if {@link #log(LogEvent)} maybe called.
085                 * @return true if log can be called.
086                 */
087                public boolean isEnabled();
088
089                /**
090                 * Route singletons and utilities.
091                 */
092                @CaseChanging
093                public enum Routes implements Route {
094
095                        /**
096                         * A route that is a NOOP and is always disabled.
097                         */
098                        NotFound {
099                                @Override
100                                public void log(LogEvent event) {
101                                }
102
103                                @Override
104                                public boolean isEnabled() {
105                                        return false;
106                                }
107
108                        }
109
110                }
111
112        }
113
114        /**
115         * Root router is a router that has child routers.
116         */
117        sealed interface RootRouter extends LogRouter permits InternalRootRouter {
118
119                /**
120                 * Level resolver to find levels for a log name.
121                 * @return level resolver.
122                 */
123                public LevelResolver levelResolver();
124
125                /**
126                 * Gets an un-cached System Logger.
127                 * @param loggerName logger name usually a class.
128                 * @return System Logger.
129                 */
130                default Logger getLogger(String loggerName) {
131                        return logger(this, loggerName);
132                }
133
134                /**
135                 * Low level convenience method for direct logging.
136                 * @param loggerName logger name.
137                 * @param level level.
138                 * @param formattedMessage already formatted message.
139                 * @param cause error at event time.
140                 */
141                default void log(String loggerName, java.lang.System.Logger.Level level, String formattedMessage,
142                                @Nullable Throwable cause) {
143                        var route = route(loggerName, level);
144                        if (route.isEnabled()) {
145                                LogEvent event = LogEvent.of(level, loggerName, formattedMessage, cause);
146                                route.log(event);
147                        }
148                }
149
150                private static Logger logger(RootRouter router, String loggerName) {
151                        if (!(router instanceof InternalRootRouter r)) {
152                                throw new IllegalArgumentException("bug");
153                        }
154                        return new DefaultSystemLogger(loggerName, r);
155                }
156
157        }
158
159        /**
160         * Router routes messages to a publisher.
161         */
162        sealed interface Router extends LogRouter, LogEventLogger {
163
164                /**
165                 * The router name given if no router is explicitely declared.
166                 */
167                public static final String DEFAULT_ROUTER_NAME = "default";
168
169                /**
170                 * Level resolver.
171                 * @return level resolver.
172                 */
173                LevelResolver levelResolver();
174
175                /**
176                 * Log publisher.
177                 * @return publisher.
178                 */
179                LogPublisher publisher();
180
181                /**
182                 * Whether or not the publisher is synchronous. A synchronous publisher generally
183                 * blocks.
184                 * @return true if the publisher is synchronous.
185                 */
186                default boolean synchronous() {
187                        return publisher().synchronous();
188                }
189
190                @Override
191                default void log(LogEvent event) {
192                        publisher().log(event);
193                }
194
195                /**
196                 * Creates a builder from config.
197                 * @param name name of the route which the publisher will inherit.
198                 * @param config config.
199                 * @return builder.
200                 */
201                static Builder builder(String name, LogConfig config) {
202                        return new Builder(name, config);
203                }
204
205                /**
206                 * Creates a router.
207                 *
208                 * @see AbstractRouter
209                 */
210                @FunctionalInterface
211                public interface RouterFactory {
212
213                        /**
214                         * Builder will call this factory if passed in.
215                         * @param publisher publisher from builder.
216                         * @param levelResolver level resolver from builder.
217                         * @param name name from builder.
218                         * @param config config from builder.
219                         * @return router.
220                         */
221                        public Router create(LogPublisher publisher, LevelResolver levelResolver, String name, LogConfig config);
222
223                        /**
224                         * Creates a router from a function.
225                         * @param function <strong>the function may return <code>null</code></strong>
226                         * which indicates to ignore.
227                         * @return factory.
228                         */
229                        static RouterFactory of(@SuppressWarnings("exports") Function<LogEvent, @Nullable LogEvent> function) {
230                                return (pub, lr, n, c) -> new AbstractRouter(pub, lr) {
231                                        @Override
232                                        protected @Nullable LogEvent transformOrNull(LogEvent event) {
233                                                return function.apply(event);
234                                        }
235                                };
236                        }
237
238                }
239
240                /**
241                 * Router builder.
242                 */
243                public final class Builder extends LevelResolver.AbstractBuilder<Builder> {
244
245                        private final LogConfig config;
246
247                        private final String name;
248
249                        private RouterFactory factory = (publisher, levelResolver, n, c) -> new SimpleRouter(publisher,
250                                        levelResolver);
251
252                        private List<LogConfig.Provider<LogAppender>> appenders = new ArrayList<>();
253
254                        private Builder(String name, LogConfig config) {
255                                this.name = Objects.requireNonNull(name);
256                                this.config = config;
257                        }
258
259                        private @Nullable PublisherFactory publisher;
260
261                        @Override
262                        protected Builder self() {
263                                return this;
264                        }
265
266                        /**
267                         * Adds an appender by giving an appender builder to a consumer.
268                         * @param name appender name.
269                         * @param consumer consumer.
270                         * @return this builder.
271                         */
272                        public Builder appender(String name, Consumer<LogAppender.Builder> consumer) {
273                                var builder = LogAppender.builder(name);
274                                consumer.accept(builder);
275                                this.appenders.add(builder.build());
276                                return this;
277                        }
278
279                        /**
280                         * Adds an appender.
281                         * @param appender appender provider.
282                         * @return this builder.
283                         */
284                        public Builder appender(LogConfig.Provider<LogAppender> appender) {
285                                this.appenders.add(Objects.requireNonNull(appender));
286                                return self();
287                        }
288
289                        /**
290                         * Sets the publisher. Only one publisher to router.
291                         * @param publisher publisher.
292                         * @return this builder.
293                         */
294                        public Builder publisher(PublisherFactory publisher) {
295                                this.publisher = publisher;
296                                return self();
297                        }
298
299                        /**
300                         * Factory to use for creating the router.
301                         * @param factory router factory.
302                         * @return this.
303                         */
304                        public Builder factory(RouterFactory factory) {
305                                this.factory = Objects.requireNonNull(factory);
306                                return this;
307                        }
308
309                        Router build() {
310                                return build(this.factory);
311                        }
312
313                        /**
314                         * Builds the router.
315                         * @param factory to create the router.
316                         * @return router.
317                         */
318                        Router build(RouterFactory factory) {
319                                String name = this.name;
320                                String routerLevelPrefix = LogProperties.interpolateNamedKey(LogProperties.ROUTE_LEVEL_PREFIX, name);
321                                var routerConfigLevelResolver = ConfigLevelResolver.of(config.properties(), routerLevelPrefix);
322                                var levelResolver = buildLevelResolver(List.of(routerConfigLevelResolver, config.levelResolver()));
323                                var publisher = this.publisher;
324
325                                List<LogConfig.Provider<LogAppender>> appenders = new ArrayList<>(this.appenders);
326                                if (appenders.isEmpty()) {
327
328                                        List<String> appenderNames = Property.builder() //
329                                                .toList() //
330                                                .orElse(List.of())
331                                                .buildWithName(LogProperties.ROUTE_APPENDERS_PROPERTY, name)
332                                                .get(config.properties())
333                                                .value();
334
335                                        DefaultAppenderRegistry.defaultAppenders(config, appenderNames) //
336                                                .stream() //
337                                                .forEach(appenders::add);
338                                }
339
340                                if (publisher == null) {
341                                        publisher = Property.builder() //
342                                                .toURI() //
343                                                .map(u -> config.publisherRegistry().provide(u, name, config.properties()))
344                                                .buildWithName(LogProperties.ROUTE_PUBLISHER_PROPERTY, name)
345                                                .get(config.properties())
346                                                .value(() -> LogPublisher.SyncLogPublisher.builder().build());
347                                }
348
349                                var apps = appenders.stream().map(a -> a.provide(name, config)).toList();
350                                var pub = publisher.create(name, config, apps);
351
352                                return factory.create(pub, levelResolver, name, config);
353                        }
354
355                }
356
357        }
358
359        /**
360         * A user supplied router usually for filtering or transforming purposes. The method
361         * required to implement is {@link #transformOrNull(LogEvent)}.
362         *
363         * @see RouterFactory
364         */
365        @SuppressWarnings("javadoc") // TODO Eclipse bug.
366        public non-sealed abstract class AbstractRouter implements Router, Route {
367
368                private final LogPublisher publisher;
369
370                private final LevelResolver levelResolver;
371
372                /**
373                 * Router tuple of publisher and resolver.
374                 * @param publisher not <code>null</code>.
375                 * @param levelResolver not <code>null</code>.
376                 */
377                protected AbstractRouter(LogPublisher publisher, LevelResolver levelResolver) {
378                        super();
379                        this.publisher = publisher;
380                        this.levelResolver = levelResolver;
381                }
382
383                @Override
384                public final boolean synchronous() {
385                        return Router.super.synchronous();
386                }
387
388                @Override
389                public final void log(LogEvent event) {
390                        var e = transformOrNull(event);
391                        if (e != null) {
392                                Router.super.log(event);
393                        }
394                }
395
396                /**
397                 * Implement for custom filtering or transformation.
398                 * @param event usually from logging facade.
399                 * @return event to be pushed to logger or not if <code>null</code>.
400                 */
401                protected abstract @Nullable LogEvent transformOrNull(LogEvent event);
402
403                @Override
404                public final Route route(String loggerName, Level level) {
405                        if (levelResolver().isEnabled(loggerName, level)) {
406                                return this;
407                        }
408                        return Route.Routes.NotFound;
409                }
410
411                @Override
412                public void start(LogConfig config) {
413                        publisher.start(config);
414                }
415
416                @Override
417                public void close() {
418                        publisher.close();
419
420                }
421
422                @Override
423                public final boolean isEnabled() {
424                        return true;
425                }
426
427                @Override
428                public final LevelResolver levelResolver() {
429                        return this.levelResolver;
430                }
431
432                @Override
433                public final LogPublisher publisher() {
434                        return this.publisher;
435                }
436
437        }
438
439}
440
441record SimpleRouter(LogPublisher publisher, LevelResolver levelResolver) implements Router, Route {
442
443        @Override
444        public void close() {
445                publisher.close();
446        }
447
448        @Override
449        public Route route(String loggerName, java.lang.System.Logger.Level level) {
450                if (levelResolver().isEnabled(loggerName, level)) {
451                        return this;
452                }
453                return Route.Routes.NotFound;
454        }
455
456        @Override
457        public boolean isEnabled() {
458                return true;
459        }
460
461        @Override
462        public void start(LogConfig config) {
463                publisher.start(config);
464        }
465
466}
467
468sealed interface InternalRootRouter extends RootRouter {
469
470        /**
471         * Sets the root router.
472         * @param router root router.
473         */
474        static void setRouter(RootRouter router) {
475                if (GlobalLogRouter.INSTANCE == router) {
476                        throw new IllegalArgumentException();
477                }
478                GlobalLogRouter.INSTANCE.drain((InternalRootRouter) router);
479        }
480
481        static InternalRootRouter of(List<? extends Router> routes, LevelResolver levelResolver) {
482
483                if (routes.isEmpty()) {
484                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("atleast one route is required");
485                }
486                List<Router> sorted = new ArrayList<>();
487                /*
488                 * We add the async routers first
489                 */
490                Set<Router> matched = Collections.newSetFromMap(new IdentityHashMap<Router, Boolean>());
491                for (var r : routes) {
492                        if (!r.synchronous()) {
493                                if (matched.add(r)) {
494                                        sorted.add(r);
495                                }
496                        }
497                }
498                for (var r : routes) {
499                        if (r.synchronous()) {
500                                if (matched.add(r)) {
501                                        sorted.add(r);
502                                }
503                        }
504                }
505                routes = sorted;
506                List<LevelResolver> resolvers = new ArrayList<>();
507                routes.stream().map(Router::levelResolver).forEach(resolvers::add);
508                resolvers.add(levelResolver);
509                var globalLevelResolver = InternalLevelResolver.cached(InternalLevelResolver.of(resolvers));
510
511                Router[] array = routes.toArray(new Router[] {});
512
513                if (array.length == 1) {
514                        var r = array[0];
515                        return r.synchronous() ? new SingleSyncRootRouter(r) : new SingleAsyncRootRouter(r);
516                }
517                return new CompositeLogRouter(array, globalLevelResolver);
518        }
519
520        default boolean isEnabled(String loggerName, java.lang.System.Logger.Level level) {
521                return route(loggerName, level).isEnabled();
522
523        }
524
525        default void log(String loggerName, java.lang.System.Logger.Level level, String message) {
526                log(loggerName, level, message, null);
527        }
528
529        default void drain(InternalRootRouter delegate) {
530
531        }
532
533}
534
535record SingleSyncRootRouter(Router router) implements InternalRootRouter {
536
537        @Override
538        public void start(LogConfig config) {
539                router.start(config);
540        }
541
542        @Override
543        public void close() {
544                router.close();
545        }
546
547        @Override
548        public LevelResolver levelResolver() {
549                return router.levelResolver();
550        }
551
552        @Override
553        public Route route(String loggerName, Level level) {
554                return router.route(loggerName, level);
555        }
556
557}
558
559record SingleAsyncRootRouter(Router router) implements InternalRootRouter {
560
561        @Override
562        public void start(LogConfig config) {
563                router.start(config);
564        }
565
566        @Override
567        public void close() {
568                router.close();
569        }
570
571        @Override
572        public LevelResolver levelResolver() {
573                return router.levelResolver();
574        }
575
576        @Override
577        public Route route(String loggerName, Level level) {
578                return router.route(loggerName, level);
579        }
580
581}
582
583record CompositeLogRouter(Router[] routers, LevelResolver levelResolver) implements InternalRootRouter, Route {
584
585        @Override
586        public Route route(String loggerName, Level level) {
587                for (var router : routers) {
588                        if (router.route(loggerName, level).isEnabled()) {
589                                return this;
590                        }
591                }
592                return Routes.NotFound;
593        }
594
595        @Override
596        public void log(LogEvent event) {
597                for (var router : routers) {
598                        var route = router.route(event.loggerName(), event.level());
599                        if (route.isEnabled()) {
600                                /*
601                                 * We assume async routers are earlier in the array.
602                                 */
603                                if (!router.synchronous()) {
604                                        /*
605                                         * Now all events are frozen from here onward to guarantee that the
606                                         * synchronous routers see the same thing as the async routers.
607                                         *
608                                         * Freeze is a noop if it already frozen.
609                                         */
610                                        event = event.freeze();
611                                }
612                                router.log(event);
613                        }
614                }
615        }
616
617        @Override
618        public boolean isEnabled() {
619                return true;
620        }
621
622        @Override
623        public void start(LogConfig config) {
624                for (var r : routers) {
625                        r.start(config);
626                }
627        }
628
629        @Override
630        public void close() {
631                for (var r : routers) {
632                        r.close();
633                }
634        }
635}
636
637enum FailsafeAppender implements LogAppender {
638
639        INSTANCE;
640
641        @Override
642        public void append(LogEvent event) {
643                if (event.level().compareTo(Level.ERROR) >= 0) {
644                        var err = System.err;
645                        if (err != null) {
646                                err.append("[ERROR] - logging ");
647                                event.formattedMessage(err);
648
649                                var throwable = event.throwableOrNull();
650                                if (throwable != null) {
651                                        throwable.printStackTrace(err);
652                                }
653                        }
654                }
655        }
656
657        @Override
658        public void append(LogEvent[] events, int count) {
659                for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
660                        append(events[i]);
661                }
662        }
663
664        @Override
665        public void close() {
666        }
667
668        @Override
669        public void start(LogConfig config) {
670        }
671
672}
673
674final class QueueEventsRouter implements InternalRootRouter, Route {
675
676        private final ConcurrentLinkedQueue<LogEvent> events = new ConcurrentLinkedQueue<>();
677
678        private static final LevelResolver INFO_RESOLVER = InternalLevelResolver.of(Level.INFO);
679
680        @Override
681        public LevelResolver levelResolver() {
682                return INFO_RESOLVER;
683        }
684
685        @Override
686        public Route route(String loggerName, Level level) {
687                if (INFO_RESOLVER.isEnabled(loggerName, level)) {
688                        return this;
689                }
690                return Routes.NotFound;
691        }
692
693        @Override
694        public void start(LogConfig config) {
695        }
696
697        @Override
698        public void close() {
699                events.clear();
700        }
701
702        @Override
703        public void log(LogEvent event) {
704                events.add(event);
705                if (event.level() == Level.ERROR) {
706                        MetaLog.error(event);
707                }
708
709        }
710
711        @Override
712        public void drain(InternalRootRouter delegate) {
713                LogEvent e;
714                while ((e = this.events.poll()) != null) {
715                        delegate.route(e.loggerName(), e.level()).log(e);
716                }
717        }
718
719        @Override
720        public boolean isEnabled() {
721                return true;
722        }
723
724}
725
726@SuppressWarnings("ImmutableEnumChecker")
727enum GlobalLogRouter implements InternalRootRouter, Route {
728
729        INSTANCE;
730
731        private volatile InternalRootRouter delegate = new QueueEventsRouter();
732
733        private final ReentrantLock drainLock = new ReentrantLock();
734
735        static boolean isShutdownEvent(String loggerName, java.lang.System.Logger.Level level) {
736                return loggerName.equals(LogLifecycle.SHUTDOWN)
737                                && Boolean.parseBoolean(System.getProperty(LogLifecycle.SHUTDOWN));
738        }
739
740        @Override
741        public LevelResolver levelResolver() {
742                return delegate.levelResolver();
743        }
744
745        @Override
746        public boolean isEnabled() {
747                return true;
748        }
749
750        @Override
751        public void log(LogEvent event) {
752                InternalRootRouter d = delegate;
753                if (d instanceof QueueEventsRouter q) {
754                        q.log(event);
755                }
756                else {
757                        String loggerName = event.loggerName();
758                        var level = event.level();
759                        var route = d.route(event.loggerName(), event.level());
760                        if (route.isEnabled()) {
761                                route.log(event);
762                        }
763                        if (isShutdownEvent(loggerName, level)) {
764                                d.close();
765                        }
766                }
767        }
768
769        @Override
770        public Route route(String loggerName, Level level) {
771                return this.delegate.route(loggerName, level);
772        }
773
774        @Override
775        public boolean isEnabled(String loggerName, Level level) {
776                return this.delegate.isEnabled(loggerName, level);
777        }
778
779        @Override
780        public void log(String loggerName, java.lang.System.Logger.Level level, String message, @Nullable Throwable cause) {
781                InternalRootRouter d = delegate;
782                d.log(loggerName, level, message, cause);
783                if (isShutdownEvent(loggerName, level)) {
784                        d.close();
785                }
786        }
787
788        @Override
789        public void drain(InternalRootRouter delegate) {
790                drainLock.lock();
791                try {
792                        var original = this.delegate;
793                        this.delegate = Objects.requireNonNull(delegate);
794                        original.drain(delegate);
795                }
796                finally {
797                        drainLock.unlock();
798                }
799        }
800
801        @Override
802        public void start(LogConfig config) {
803        }
804
805        @Override
806        public void close() {
807                this.delegate.close();
808        }
809
810}
811
812@SuppressWarnings("null") // TODO eclipse bug
813class DefaultSystemLogger implements System.Logger {
814
815        private final String name;
816
817        private final InternalRootRouter router;
818
819        public DefaultSystemLogger(String name, InternalRootRouter router) {
820                super();
821                this.name = name;
822                this.router = router;
823        }
824
825        @Override
826        public String getName() {
827                return this.name;
828        }
829
830        @Override
831        public boolean isLoggable(Level level) {
832                return router.isEnabled(name, level);
833        }
834
835        @Override
836        public void log(Level level, @Nullable ResourceBundle bundle, @Nullable String msg, @Nullable Throwable thrown) {
837                String message = requireNonNullElse(msg, "");
838                router.log(name, level, message, thrown);
839        }
840
841        @Override
842        public void log(Level level, @Nullable ResourceBundle bundle, @Nullable String format, @Nullable Object... params) {
843                // TODO Eclipse Null bug
844                @NonNull
845                String message = requireNonNullElse(format, "");
846                String formattedMessage;
847                if (params != null && params.length > 0 && !message.isBlank()) {
848                        formattedMessage = MessageFormat.format(message, params);
849                }
850                else {
851                        formattedMessage = message;
852                }
853                router.log(name, level, formattedMessage, null);
854        }
855
856}
